snippet: Residents of Canastota, N.Y. were stunned and angry after four championship belts that belonged to Carmen Basilio, a native who won titles in the 1950s, were stolen from the International Boxing Hall of Fame in town.
abstract: Theft of four championship belts once belonging to boxer Carmen Basilio from International Boxing Hall of Fame in Canastota, NY, has stunned community that remains attached to Basilio, decades after he brought fame to town.

byline.original: By JEFF STEIN and COREY KILGANNON
byline.contributor: Jeff Stein reported from Canastota, and Corey Kilgannon from New York.

lead_paragraph: Residents of Canastota, N.Y. were stunned and angry after four championship belts that belonged to Carmen Basilio, a native who won titles in the 1950s, were stolen from the International Boxing Hall of Fame in town.

headline.main: Theft of a Boxer’s Championship Belts Devastates His Upstate Hometown
headline.print_headline: Theft of Boxer’s Belts Stuns His Hometown
